newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - District of Columbia.

text.p: SUMMARY NOTICE OF BOND SALE
District of Columbia
(Washington, D.C.)
General Obligation Bonds, Series 1997A
Notice is hereby given that sealed proposals will be received and considered by the Chief Financial Officer of the District of Columbia (the
District''), in Suite 3
One Judiciary Square, 441 4th Street N.W., Washington D.C. 20001, on
until 12:00 Noon, E.D.T. at which time and place the bids will be opened and announced for the purchase of the District's $233,945,000* aggregate principal amount of

General Obligation Bonds, Series 1997A (the Bonds'') dated May 15, 1997. Each bid must be for all of said $233,945,000* bonds. No proposal shall be considered unless there is deposited with the District as a downpayment a certified check or cashier's check in an amount equal to at least two per centum of the par amount of the Bonds. The District reserves the right to change said public sale date by announcing such change by Munifacts News Service no later 20 hours prior to the hour fixed for receipt of bids. If the date of sale is changed, bids will be received for the Bonds at the same place and at such date and time as shall be designated by the Chief Financial Officer of the District in said Munifacts News Service notice. Failure of any bidder to receive such Munifacts notice shall not affect the legality of the sale. The District reserves the right to reject any and all bids. The Bonds will be sold to the bidder specifying the lowest true interest cost calculated in accordance with the Official Terms of Bond Sale.
The Bonds are being issued for the purpose of financing certain capital projects or refunding certain capital
indebtedness of the District. The Bonds are general

obligations of the District and the full faith and credit of the District is pledged to the payment of the principal of and interest on the Bonds when due and by further security provisions as described in the Preliminary Official

Statement. The Bonds are further secured by a security interest in and lien on the funds derived from a special real property tax levied by the District and required to be collected annually, without limitation as to rate or amount, in amounts sufficient to pay the principal and interest on the Bonds and any outstanding Parity Bonds when due. The funds derived from the special real property tax are subject to the security interest and lien when collected by the District. When collected, such funds shall be set aside in a separate fund dedicated to the payment of principal of and interest on the Bonds and any outstanding Parity Bonds.
Bidders must refer to the full Official Terms of Bond Sale for the complete terms and conditions of the sale. Copies of the Preliminary Official Statement, the Official Terms of

Bond Sale, the Official Bid Form, and the form of the opinion of Squire, Sanders & Dempsey L.L.P., bond counsel to the District, may be obtained from Pamela Holton, Associate Treasurer, 441 4th Street, NW, Suite 360, Washington, D.C. 20001, (202) 727-6055.
Anthony A. Williams
Chief Financial Officer
District of Columbia
*The aggregate principal amount of the Bonds may be adjusted as determined by the District as described in the Official Terms of Bond Sale.
Dated: May 15, 1997
(From The Bond Buyer)
